closing the trade route and borders would mean serious short-term damage to the country’s economic health. Salim therefore appealed to all UN member states to provide immediate financial, material and technical aid to buoy Mozambique’s economy and support the sanctions.

As for the liberation struggle in Namibia, the FLS coalition viewed Salim’s coordinating role in the UN Special Committee on Decolonization as among the most important dimensions of its broader strategy to support the end of South Africa’s illegal occupation of Namibia.
